docs.abstract: The debate on race and policing may be at a boiling point, but it’s been simmering in communities across the United States for years.
docs.snippet: The debate on race and policing may be at a boiling point, but it’s been simmering in communities across the United States for years.
docs.lead_paragraph: Editors’ note, June 12, 2020: The divisive national debate on race and policing may be at a boiling point, but it’s been simmering in communities across the country for years. We wanted to highlight this video from 2018, when filmmaker Samantha Knowles documented the tense conversations on whether her hometown was willing to say that black lives matter as much as blue.

headline.main: How Can a Small Town Talk About Race?

docs.abstract: As the Marvel series returns, Cheo Hodari Coker discusses changes for the second season and the superhero’s perceived conservatism.
docs.snippet: As the Marvel series returns, Cheo Hodari Coker discusses changes for the second season and the superhero’s perceived conservatism.
docs.lead_paragraph: When the first season of “Luke Cage” made its debut on Netflix in 2016, anticipation was high: Inspired by the character who made his first appearance in comic books during the blaxploitation era, it featured an impressive cast — including Mike Colter, Alfre Woodard and Mahershala Ali — and a more subversive and political superhero narrative than many of Marvel Comics’ previous forays onto the screen. The titular character, a bulletproof ex-convict with superhuman strength who rids Harlem of its criminals, made the series ripe for comparisons to the Black Lives Matter movement.

headline.main: ‘Luke Cage’ Season 2: A New Villain and Respectability Politics
headline.print_headline: A New Villain and Respectability Politics

docs.abstract: Despite promises from City Hall to Albany for the Civil Rights statute to be revised, the disciplinary history of police officers still cannot be disclosed.
docs.snippet: Despite promises from City Hall to Albany for the Civil Rights statute to be revised, the disciplinary history of police officers still cannot be disclosed.
docs.lead_paragraph: The legal battle over a New York City police officer’s disciplinary records after the chokehold death of Eric Garner in 2014 cast an obscure statute into the spotlight.

headline.main: 4 Years After Eric Garner’s Death, Secrecy Law on Police Discipline Remains Unchanged
headline.print_headline: Law Unchanged Despite Calls for Transparency

docs.abstract: A blue line intended to show support for police instead turned neighbors against each other.
docs.snippet: A blue line intended to show support for police instead turned neighbors against each other.
docs.lead_paragraph: A blue line intended to show support for police instead turned neighbors against each other.

headline.main: A Town Divided Over Blue Lives Matter
